indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Improved bio-geographic coverage of PA system: by 2020 an additional 5.3 million ha of the least represented desert and semi-desert ecosystems added to the PA estate. 2. Integrated land-use planning under implementation at 9 million ha of desert landscapes, ensuring preservation of ecosystem functions. 3. Demonstration of effective mechanisms and tools for engagement of local communities and other non-PA actors in PA management.

baseline.comment: 1. The current PA system falls short in terms of its bio-geographic representation, with desert ecosystems being currently under-represented. 2. PA design and expansion decisions are not considering the broader, landscape-level processes. 3. Collaborative management in PA governance in Kazakhstan remains a gap.

target.comment: 1. To enhance the sustainability of desert ecosystems in Protected Areas System. 2. Land-use planning and assessment of pasture ecosystems, saxaul and Tugai forests and wetlands in pilot sites of Ile-Balkhash and Aral-Syrdarya project areas 3. Analysis and selection of the methods and approaches to identify boundaries of wildlife corridors in two project areas. 4. Socio-economic survey within three project areas. 5. Establishment of dedicated micro-credit line to support biodiversity-compatible activities of communities in and around the desert and semi-desert ecosystems

actual.comment: 1. In order to establish basis for enhancement of representativeness of desert ecosystems, the land was allocated for “Ile-Balkhash” SNR establishment of total area of 415 164,2 ha and the scientific background report on Ustyurt SNR expansion of total area of 223 342 ha was developed. 2. The guidelines for land use planning and allotment of the area for establishment of wildlife corridors in Ile Balkhash and Aral-Syrdarya project areas were identified. 3. Analysis of migratory routes and habitats of ungulates was done in fall period within two project areas. To get reliable monitoring data by migratory routes, the satellite transmitters (collars) were purchased. 4. To identify life standards of the rural communities and biodiversity-compatible livelihoods in two project areas, the socio-economic survey was conducted. 5. In order to develop biodiversity-compatible livelihoods in two project areas, the “Eco Damu” micro-credit program was launched through the Fund for Financial Support of Agriculture.

target.comment: 1. Improving sustainability and PA staff capacity building in desert and semi desert ecosystems 2. Landscape planning of Ile-Balkhash and Aral-Syrdariya project territories 3. Demonstration of sustainable practices on conservation and use of pastures, saxaul , riparian forests and wetlands on pilot territories 4. Development of project decisions on ecological monitoring system improvement and information distribution in target desert ecosystems 5.Community involvement in creation of PA Public Committees in pilot territories of SNNP Altyn Emel, Barsakelmes reserve 6. Implementation of “Eco-Damu” micro-finance program for target support of sustainable livelihoods of rural communities living around and in PA 7. Identification of ecosystem services in two project areas –Ile Balkhash and Aral-Syrdarya

actual.comment: 1.Management plans of pilot PAs (Ustuyrt Reserve, Barsakelmes Reserve, Altyn Emel National Park) were developed and approved by the Order of authorized body. The biodiversity of desert and semi-desert ecosystems monitoring program on the example of pilot PAs was developed. 2. Landscape planning of Ile-Balkhash and Aral-Syrdariya project territories is determined on the basis of landscape approach. In the result, more than 13,0 mln. ha of lands are covered by territorial planning and basis for introduction of sustainable land-use management in targeted desert zones has been created 3.Four grant projects are realized in two project territories, two of them are on restoration of degraded lands (Aral-Syrdariya and Ile-Balkhash), 1 project – diversification of water-resistant monocultures areas , 1 project – restoration of poplar forests (Ile-Balkhash region) 4.The project decisions on structure and content of ecological monitoring data base web-portal are developed. 5. Informational company on mobilization of community was held. Public Committees in two project PAs (SNNP Altyn Emel, Barsakelmes reserve) are created. Community involvement in creation of PA Public Committees in pilot territories of SNNP Altyn Emel, Barsakelmes reserve 6. In the framework of “Eco-Damu” microlending program for targeted support of stable income source of rural population living around SNPA “Fund for financial support of agriculture” JSC had approved and funded 46 projects for the amount of 157,2 million KZT, including 17 business women’ projects. In Almaty region 20 projects worth 68.6 million KZT were financed, 21 project for the amount of 68.8 million KZT in Kyzylorda oblast, and 5 projects totaling 19.8 million KZT in Mangystau region. 7. To identify ecosystem services in two project areas in the framework of the works the classification of ecosystem services was completed, priority ecosystem services, and large-scale users of ecosystem services were identified, maps of ecosystem servi

result.title: Objective
result.description: To enhance the sustainability of protected areas in globally important desert and semi-desert ecosystems by expanding their geographic coverage, promoting a landscape approach, and supporting biodiversity-compatible livelihoods in and around PAs.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Coverage of underrepresented Southern desert in the PA System of Kazakhstan

baseline.comment: 1,591,800 ha (5.3% of ecological zone)

target.comment: By 2015 coverage of Southern desert in PA system increases by 2,682,032 ha (8.9% of the ecological zone). This increase comes from the following: Establishment of 1 new PA (Mangistau State Reserved Zone) covering 2,676,262 ha, Expansion of 1 existing PA (Barsakelmes State Nature Reserve) by 5,770 ha. By 2020 coverage of Southern desert in PA system increases by approximately 970,000 ha (3.2% of the ecological zone). This increase comes from: Expansion of 1 existing PA (Ustyurt State Nature Reserve) by approximately 220,000 ha, Establishment of a wildlife corridor between Barsakelmes and Ustyurt PAs of approximately 750,000 ha

actual.comment:
1,591,800 ha (5.3% of ecological zone) as in the baseline
The following activities have been initiated/completed by the project to ensure the achievement of the EoP target:
-Plan of land boundaries allotment for establishment of Mangistau protected area of total area 2,600,000 ha is being approved by local government (akimat) of Mangistau Oblast.
-Works on approval of land use design and feasibility study (TEO) to expand Barsakelmes reserve’s area at local government (akimat) level of Kyzylorda Oblast were performed.
- dialogue platform was created to openly discuss issues related to adding 23,000 ha of the Syrdaria river delta to the Barsakelmes reserve.
-scientific background report (ENO) for expansion of the Ustyurt reserve’s area to 704,000 ha (2.3% of ecological zone) was developed. ENO was approved by the authorized body, report on the positive state ecological appraisal was obtained. The feasibility study (TEO) to expand the reserve’s area is being developed.
-field studies on habitation of rare ungulate species of animals between Barsakelmes and Ustyurt PAs were conducted. Habitation and animal migration maps were drawn for three routes with total length of 841 km. The results of scientific works will be used to establish the proposed ecological corridor.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Coverage of underrepresented Mountain-valley subtype desert in the PA System of Kazakhstan

baseline.comment: 99,704 ha (3.3% of ecological zone)

target.comment:
By 2015 coverage of Mountain-valley subtype desert in PA system increases by 1,602,504 ha (53.4% of the ecological zone). This increase comes from the following:
- Establishment of 1 new PA (Ile-Balkhash State Nature Reserve) covering 442,296 ha
- Expansion of 1 existing PA (Altyn Yemel State National Nature Park) by 460,208 ha
- Establishment of a wildlife corridor between Altyn Yemel and Ile-Balkhash PAs of 700,000 ha
By 2020 coverage of Mountain-valley subtype desert in PA system increases by approximately 30,000 ha (1% of the ecological zone). This increase comes from the following:
- Establishment of 1 new PA (Arganaty) covering approximately 30,000 ha

indicator.description: Size of flagship species populations of desert & semi-desert ecosystems in target areas remains at the baseline level or increase

Koulan: 1,700

Aral Syrdarya Project Area:

Koulan: 340
Pallas's sandgrouse: 407

Ustyurt argali: 1,020
Goitered gazelle: 270

target.comment:
Ile Balkhash Project Area:
Goitered gazelle: 1800=
Koulan: 1700=
Argali: 205=
Aral Syrdarya Project Area:
Goitered gazelle: 80=
Koulan: 340=

actual.comment:
Ile-Balkhash project area (“Altyn Yemel” national Park):
Goitered gazelle: 3998
Koulan: 2692
Argali: 205
Aral-Syrdaria project area (Barsakelmes reserve):
Goitered gazelle: 83
Koulan: 471
Pallas’s sandgrouse: 467

Ustyurt argali: 1,074
Goitered gazelle: 277
Houbara bustard: 74
Increase in the number of indicator species this reporting period results from improved conservation measures of pilot PAs and the project’s support in upgrading PAs' technical capacities.
The results on animals numerosity records and report on poaching were obtained from National Park "Altyn Yemel", Barsakelmes reserve, Ustyurt reserve.

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: PA system of Kazakhstan contains representative samples of desert and semi-desert ecosystems under various conservation regimes and is effective in protecting ecosystems and ecological processes

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Enhanced management effectiveness of existing PAs that are expanded under the project (as measured by METT)

baseline.comment:
Altyn Yemel: 50%
Barsakelmes: 42%
Ustyurt: 43%

target.comment:
Altyn Yemel: 75%
Barsakelmes: 67%
Ustyurt: 68%

actual.comment:
Altyn-Yemel: 59 %
Barsakelmes: 49 %
Ustyurt: 43 %
Improvement of METT indicators for the two pilot PAs stems from the upgrade of facilities and capacity building activities.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Enhanced management effectiveness of new PAs that are established under the project (as measured by METT)

baseline.comment:
Ile-Balkhash: 19%
Mangistau: 7%
Arganaty: 9%

target.comment:
Ile-Balkhash: 44%
Mangistau: 32%
Arganaty: 34%

actual.comment:
Ile-Balkhash: 21 %
Mangystau: 7 %
Arganaty: 9 %
The Project's support related to the provision of inspection services for the Ile-Balkhash Region contributed towards the increase of the METT indicator for the Ile-Balkhash (from 19% to 21%).

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Landscape-level conservation planning and management are developed and implemented in target desert and semi-desert environments

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Territorial development plans employing landscape management approach

baseline.comment: 0 ha

target.comment: 9 million ha

actual.comment:
0 ha
Scheme development for land-use planning of Aral Syrdaria (Aral and Kazaly districts) and Ile-Balkhash (Balkhash district) project areas is being completed.
Based on identified priorities of socio-economic development and nature-resource potential, land-use planning will create a basis for sustainable land management. Expected total area for land-use planning is 13,000,000 ha.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Number of hectares of restored wetlands & delta lakes

baseline.comment: 0 ha

actual.comment:
0 ha
For the reporting period the current situation for 2 delta lakes was assessed: Aidarkol (Aral -Syrdaria) and Kelte (ile-Balkhash). Hydrological studies on detection of optimum water level, needed for their restoration are being carried out.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Number of hectares of riparian & saksaul forests under sustainable management

baseline.comment: 0 ha

actual.comment:
1,500 ha
For the reporting period the state of saxaul and tugai forests was assessed, ways of conservation and restoration of such forests were identified.
To restore saxaul forests in the Aral-Syrdaria region, a project on establishment of forest nursery for saxaul and other hardy-shrub species is being implemented. As a result, for the reporting period 1,500 ha of saxaul were planted in the Aral pilot area.
In the Ile-Balkhash region, a pilot project on conservation of the relict Asiatic poplar (turanga) small woods covering an area of 1,800 ha is being implemented.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Quality and quantity of vegetation cover in rangelands in 3 rural districts

baseline.comment:
Hectares of land with significant signs of soil erosion caused by overgrazing in selected plots[1]
[1] Baseline to be estimated at the beginning of the project once monitoring sites are identified and primary data are collected.

target.comment: Reduction of the size of the area heavily affected by soil erosion by at least 15% in the Ile Balkhash area and 20% in the Aral Syrdarya target area

actual.comment:
The Project implements pilot projects in two rural areas. Total area of degraded pastures is 11, 000 ha. Activities are being implemented to improve their quality and demonstrate sustainable distant-pasture cattle rearing practices. Monitoring sites were selected and initial indicators of the land degradation factor were identified in pasture plots “Dala Karatay” and “Nausha Bulak”:
- Nausha Bulak (5,000 ha) – the land degradation factor is 30% of total monitoring area;
- Dala Karatay (6,000 ha) – the land degradation factor is 35% of total monitoring area.
The quality indicator variability will be assessed after the achievement of envisaged outcomes of the pilot projects.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Presence of plant species which negatively affect the function of distant rangelands

baseline.comment:
Hectares of distant rangelands with significant signs of natural succession due to under grazing[1]
[1] Same as previous footnote

target.comment: Unwanted plant species in at least 4 rangeland monitoring plots are less than 5% surface coverage

actual.comment:
Initial indicators of unwanted plant species (bitterling, peganum) coverage were identified in selected monitoring pasture plots:
- Nausha Bulak pasture plot (5,000 ha) - the area covered by unwanted plants at the beginning of pilot project implementation comprise 750 ha or 15% of total area.
- Dala Karatay plot (6,000 ha) - initial indicator of unwanted plants is 550 ha or 9.1% of total area.
The quality indicator variability will be assessed after the achievement of envisage outcomes of the pilot projects.

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: Average income of families participating in the measures on pasture management

target.comment: Increase by at least 20%

actual.comment:
$1600
The average annual income increase of participating farms in pilot projects is being assessed.
The indicator variability will be assessed after the achievement of expected outcomes of the pilot projects.

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: Number of farmer associations that use the experiences of this project as a model

baseline.comment: No projects which use participatory bottom-up approaches in the target areas

target.comment: At least 15 farmer associations or rural consumer cooperatives in the Aral Syrdarya target area and 25 in the Ile Balkhash area use the experience of this project as a model.

actual.comment:
More than 20 farms in the Aral-Syrdaria and Ile-Balkhash project areas, as well as local authorities, NGOs, scientific institutions are informed on the options and benefits of green technology application in the irrigated agriculture and distant-pasture cattle rearing.
As a result, support was granted for implementation, demonstration and replication of recommended approaches by already 3 farms.

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Community involvement in conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity in and around PAs is enhanced

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Reduction in poaching and illegal logging at target PAs (annual) per unit of patrolling effort, compared with year of initial patrolling

baseline.comment:
Ile-Balkhash Target Area
Illegal logging violations: 67
Poaching violations: 436
Total violations: 503
Aral-Syrdarya Target Area
Illegal logging violations: 241
Poaching violations: 157
Total violations: 398

target.comment: Reduction by 40%

actual.comment:
Ile-Balkhash target area
(“Altyn Yemel” National Park, Kurtinskiy and Bakanasskiy forestry stations)
Illegal logging: 49
Poaching: 368
Total, violations:417
Aral-Syrdaria target area (Barsakelmes SNR, Aral forestry station)
Illegal logging: 212
Poaching: 118
Total, violations: 330
Overall, during the reporting period,the registered reduction of illegal logging and poaching is 17% in target PAs. It stems from improved conservation activities of regional environment-oriented services and the project support in upgrading PAs resource and technical bases.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Functioning stakeholder engagement mechanism for transparency in PA planning and management

baseline.comment: No PA public committees for mobilizing stakeholders in and around PAs in the Ile-Balkhash and Aral-Syrdarya target areas

target.comment: Two (2) operational PA public committees

actual.comment:
0
In target project areas (Ile-Balkhash and Aral-Syrdaria), the Project run awareness raising campaigns on objectives and purposes of public committees establishment.
The work on mobilization of local communities and establishment of two public committees in the National Park “Altyn Yemel” and Barsakelmes reserve is ongoing.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Number of PES agreements under implementation in project area

target.comment: 2 by project end

actual.comment:
0
To implement the payments for ecosystem services (PES) mechanism the following work stages were identified:
1) identification of ecosystem services (determinations of key providers and consumers of ecosystem services (2015);
2) economic assessment of ecosystem services (2016);
3) holding negotiations with consumers of ecosystem services, development of PES Agreements and signing contracts with consumers of ecosystem services (2016-2017).
During the reporting period works on identification of ecosystem services in the Ile-Balkhash and Aral-Syrdaria project areas were conducted.
Providers and consumers of ecosystem services were identified. A map of ecosystem services is being elaborated.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Share of registered land users and low-income rural households benefiting from biodiversity microcredit line

actual.comment:
2%
As part of the completed socio-economic studies, 48 households with a low level of income were identified in the project areas.
730 registered land users located near pilot PAs were identified.
16 registered land users (2%) in three project areas already obtained access to the project's microcredit funds through a Microcredit program “Eco-Damu”, which is administered by the Financing Fund for Agricultural Support (FFAS).

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: The income distribution of the Mangystau Oblast’s population (Gini Coefficient)

baseline.comment: The income distribution of the Mangystau Oblast’s population (Gini Coefficient) is 0.174 in 2012

actual.comment: • In order to systematize the work to increase employment in the region and clarify areas of work studies of the labor market of Mangystau region was conducted •Workshop ans consultations for oralmans (repatriants) were conducted •10 persons with disabilities were trained remotely to the following professions "site administrator", "translator", "accountant", "designer" • In order to enhance the capacity of NGOs, UNDP conducted training on human rights and human rights mechanisms for civil society • Workshop "The role of mediation in the prevention of social and labor conflicts" was conducted for the representatives of labor union • Grant program for inclusive projects implemented • 2 online centers in two districts of Mangystau region were launched • Grant program for SMEs implemented. • 13 from rural area were trained to felting • To learn from the experiences of the East Kazakhstan region for the development of local self-government and the use of energy-efficient and water-saving technologies to solve local problems, representatives of the 5 districts of the region took part in study tour the East Kazakhstan region • Grant program on self governance was implemented in one rural district of Mangystau region. • Modernization of the lighting system of one of the high school were conducted • Assessment of the current state of agricultural activities of Mangystau region conducted • Criteria for the selection of the pilot sites for the demonstration of sustainable agricultural practices developed • TOT for social workers was conducted

target.comment: To increase the income distribution of the Mangystau Oblast’s population (Gini Coefficient) to 0.200

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: - National and sectoral strategies/plans/guidelines are reviewed to include climate change adaptation in agricultural sector; number of strategies - State and private sector financing is assigned to agricultural development, with a specific emphasis on climate change resilience; amount of funding - Capacity for local, regional and national stakeholders on climate resilience and agricultural development increased; level of information-exchange and collaboration - Regional dialogue on food security supported; number of joint initiatives and partners

baseline.comment: Lack of both short-term weather and long-term climate information in Kazakhstan is viewed as a significant weakness in the agriculture sector. At the same time long-term and reliable prediction of weather forecasts for the growing season can increase the productivity of wheat production by up to 50% and improve sustainability and economic performance in Kazakhstan. Available climate information is sufficient to ensure adaptation to expected impacts. Therefore, a broader analysis of ongoing and needed interventions, with specific focus on the wheat sector and agro ecosystems, is needed. There is no common vision and understanding of the possible implications of climate variability and change on wheat and food security in the Central Asian region. In order to identify actions that can be taken individually and collectively to respond, a review of ongoing and completed actions is needed. These will be followed up by specific research on the wheat sector, with concrete recommendations and conclusions.

target.comment: 1: Established one comprehensive agro meteorological dataset 2: At least 120 stakeholders using climate information 3: At least 240 people are benefited from participation in the climate variability and change trainings and workshops. 4: Five national institutions with improved capacity to address climate variability and change.

actual.comment: 1. Established long term climate forecast software/tool at the Kazhydromet which hasimproved the climate accuranct from 64 to 87%. 2. Mobilized more than 700 farmers through demonstration plots established both in Tajikistan and Kazakhstan. 3. More than 550 Farmers, scientists, land users and other practitioners have improved their knowledge and understanding through participation at the 12 round series of training and workshop conducted in close cooerpation with the USAID CCRD projects. 4. 12 Institutions have mainstreamed 6 new training modules into their learning programms.

Developed concept of geoportal and established synoptic long term forecaster at the bases of Space research institute and Kazhydromet respectively.
More than 750 farmers are directly testing/approbating new package of long term climate forecast including drought forecasts.
More than 1240 farmers are benefited from participation in the climate variability and change trainings and workshop including field days.
Improved at least 80 stakeholders’ knowledge and experience at local level on climate resilient practices improved.
Six national institutions (Kazhydromet, Space Research Institute, KazAgroMarketing, KazAgroInnovation, Ministry of Agriculture and Ministry of Energy (Dept. on climate change adaptation)) with improved capacity to address climate variability and change.
More than 20 adaptation options demonstrated through established demonstration and pilot plots in the area of 22 ha and 44 multipurpose trials.
Produced 5 studies/expert reports/recommendations on wheat sector and climate change conducted and disseminated.
At least 80 Central Asian farmers, agricultural experts, land users and institutions with improved capacity to address climate variability and change
More than 20 learning and knowledge management products documented and disseminated through national and regional events arranged by the project.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Pastures and crop land capacity assessed and incorporated as active components in Integrated Land Use Plans, Improved 20 000 of abandoned lands through introduction of at least three new advanced practices on pasture logging/watering Decrease grazing rate of moderately degraded pastures by 40%; 2. At least two policy and legal documents regulating system of agricultural subsidies in Kazakhstan 3. promotes small-scale holders leading to soil and vegetation quality improvements. 4. Pastures and crop land capacities assessed and incorporated as active components in Integrated Land Use Plans, 5. At least two state programs reorient funding from traditional to ‘green’ agriculture.

baseline.comment: 1. Land use planning does not account for ecosystem values, leading to ecosystem degradation 2. Absence of advanced practices on pasture logging/watering; 3. Inadequate policy and legal framework to support a transformation to SLM 4. Traditional subsidies in agriculture prioritize productivity and take no heed of ecosystem carrying capacity 5. Limited and inefficient investments in pasture and maintenance of productive landscapes

target.comment: 1. Inception workshop 2. The national project team are in place 3. Assessment of national regulatory document on agricultural system of subsidy 4. Development of methodology for conducting inventory of pastures and crop land capacities in five target regions 5. Prioritization of implementation activities per each target regions

actual.comment: 1. Conducted one inception workshop 2. Project personnel are on board (Project manager, Project admin assistant) 3. Produced conducted report on agricultural subsidies in Kazakhstan 4. Produced methodology for pasture land inventory analyses based on the East Kazakhstan regions as one of the pilot project areas. 5. Identified five priority topics per ach target zones on demonstration plots. (fruit and vegetable growing for Almaty region, Wheat, crop diversification and precise agriculture for Akmola regions, Pastoral livestock breeding for East Kazakhstan regions, Crop husbandry and diversification, Pasture and precise agriculture for Kostanay region, Soil desalinization, crop diversification and organic farming for Kyzylorda region and Wheat, crop diversification and precise agriculture for North Kazakhstan regions.
